events.title: Wild Things: The Power of Nature in Our Lives (2018-2020)
events.description: June 28, 2018 - January 12, 2020Recipient of the BCMA Award of Merit: Excellence in Exhibitions 2019!The Museum of Vancouver and Nature Vancouver proudly present the illuminating exhibition, Wild Things: The Power of Nature in Our Lives. This exhibition delves into the life stories of local animals and plants—how they relate to each other and how they connect people to nature in the city. Scenic design, videos, taxidermy, crowdsourcing technologies, and the display of natural specimens breathe life into these tales of co-habitation. The immersive nature of the exhibition, including hands-on activities, encourages visitors to examine their relationship with nature, think about momentarily disconnecting from their devices, and find equilibrium with the natural world around them.  **CONTEST CLOSED** Thank you so much to everyone who submitted their nature photos! The contest winner has been notified.Hancock Wildlife Foundation (HWF) presents a streaming live view of this bald eagle nest located in Delta, British Columbia, Canada.There have been eagles in this territory in Delta, British Columbia, not far from the Tsawwassen Ferry, since at least the late 1990s. They initially took over and rebuilt a red tail hawk nest, then nested on high tension power poles for a few years, then moved back to the nest in 2010 and successfully raised two eaglets.  A camera was installed for 2011, and as of fall 2018, Hancock Wildlife Foundation have watched the pair successfully raise eleven young eagles. Co-CurationLee Beavington, Kwantlen Polytechnic University InstructorViviane Gosselin, MOV Lead CuratorDesign and Co-CurationDaniel Irvine, Principle ArchitectureChad Manley, Chad Manley Practice in Landscape and Building ArtsTerms and Conditions   Privacy Policy   Site Map

events.title: That Which Sustains Us (opened in 2020),
events.description:
That Which Sustains Us is a long-term exhibition that will explore the 
convergence of different knowledge traditions in the Vancouver area through 
an examination of people’s interactions with forests and their natural 
environment.

events.title: June 2025
events.description: Join Julia for a stroll through the forest to get to know the common forest plants of our region, learning key characteristics and fun tips to tell them apart! We'll learn how these plants are ecologically connected to each other and the wildlife of our region. Join us for a stroll down the lush South Creek Trail, learning about the trees towering above, the mossy carpet below, and the wildlife calling this forest home -- from woodpeckers to coyotes to little brown bats. When you think of a bee, chances are you imagine the European honeybee. But what about our native pollinators? Here in BC, we have over 400 species of native bees! Come along for this buzzing outing to learn about their life cycles and ecology -- from large fuzzy bumble bees to charming leaf-cutter bees to tiny bees less than 5 mm long! Join our monthly birding program to appreciate the local birds of the summer season - no experience necessary! Does the air we breathe merit the same attention that we dedicate to the food we eat? Join this Air Tasting Workshop to use the senses to understand the atmosphere as our shared habitat. Do you find yourself wandering through the Park and wondering about the tall trees that greet you? Join us for some beginner tree identification! What could be the connection between rufous hummingbirds, red-breasted sapsuckers, and insects in the forest? Where do little brown bats go in the daytime? Who's been visiting the flowers and berries in the forest? Join us for a forest ecology walk to learn about the hidden connections from the mossy ground to the treetop canopies! We're in the thick of summer, with fledglings beginning to take to the tree branches and learning to fend for themselves. Join us on our casual monthly birding program, Birds of a Feather! As you venture along the wetland trail, you might hear the croaks and calls of nearby frogs, the quacks of resident ducks, and the buzz of bumblebees and dragonflies flying above the water -- if you're lucky, you also might just spot a beaver! How well do you know the animals that call Beaver Lake home?

events.description:
Playland is now open on weekends – and select Saturdays in June featuring extended hours! Get ready to play up high at Vancouver’s favorite amusement park. Your summer excitement starts here!Don’t miss out on our special June Ticket Bundle Offer. Enter FUNFOR4* – it’s the perfect way to double your fun and save!Want the ultimate access? A Playland Season Pass gets you in for less than the cost of three visits (select dates May to August 2025) along with special perks just for passholders.  Playland rides have limited capacities. We recommend that you plan out your day in advance and enjoy your favourite rides first as admission does not guarantee experiencing all rides. For our guests looking to optimize their day we recommend choosing rides with shorter lines.  Please Note: Line cuts may occur to ensure all guests in the queue are able to enjoy the ride or attraction prior to park close. Make sure to line up for your favourite rides early! To provide Playland guests with the highest quality experience, attraction maintenance is occasionally necessary. We do our best to update the status online in advance, but unscheduled closures may happen during operations. Please visit www.pne.ca/rides the day of your visit for the most up to date ride status. Great for guests of all ages looking for more family-friendly rides and attractions, including: Balloon Explorers, Bug Whirled, Cap’n KC, Choppers, Climbing wall, Cool Cruzers, Dizzy Drop, The Flutterbye, Gladiator, Glass House, Honeybee Express, Kettle Creek Mine Coaster, Merry-Go-Round, Rock-n-Cars, Scrambler, Sea-to-Sky Swinger, Super Slide, Sweet Escape Mini Golf, Teacups, Westcoast Wheel.For those wanting all the thrills including (minimum height requirements of 48 – 56 inches): ThunderVolt, Atmosfear, The Beast, Breakdance, Cedar Rapids Log Flume, Enterprise, The Pirate Ship, Hellevator, Hell’s Gate, Skybender, The Wooden Roller Coaster and all the Fun Pass rides as well.Great for guests of all ages looking for more family-friendly rides and attractions, including: Balloon Explorers, Bug Whirled, Cap’n KC, Choppers, Climbing wall, Cool Cruzers, Dizzy Drop, The Flutterbye, Gladiator, Glass House, Honeybee Express, Kettle Creek Mine Coaster, Merry-Go-Round, Rock-n-Cars, Scrambler, Sea-to-Sky Swinger, Super Slide, Sweet Escape Mini Golf, Teacups, Westcoast Wheel.For those wanting all the thrills including (minimum height requirements of 48 – 56 inches): ThunderVolt, Atmosfear, The Beast, Breakdance, Cedar Rapids Log Flume, Enterprise, The Pirate Ship, Hellevator, Hell’s Gate, Skybender, The Wooden Roller Coaster and all the Fun Pass rides as well.The Thrill Season Pass includes all Fun Pass rides and attractions.Built by Zamperla, the ThunderVolt experience carries 12 passengers at a time through a supernatural environment with extraordinary animals, graphics and lighting that pulses as the ride system charges, leading up to its launch. The three-car train blasts off with 1.3 Gs of acceleration through an illuminated tunnel, up a steep incline before an 18-meter drop. Got a lot of friends / family who like rides, and food, and fun?Big fun = big savings for groups of 10 or more people for Playland…Planning the Best Birthday Ever? Leave the prep, planning, and clean up to us! Enjoy a full day of outdoor entertainment and give your kids a party to remember! Choose from a variety of packages …With summer approaching, plan your ideal work event with Playland or the PNE Fair NOW and enjoy a custom package loaded with endless entertainment and tasty meal bundles for 50 or more employees! The PNE wants your visit to Playland to be as enjoyable as possible.If you have any questions, concerns or feedback please contact Guest Services at:Email: gx@pne.ca document.getElementById( "neolane_trackingTag" ).src = https://pne.fan-one.com/r/ + Math.random().toString() + "?tagid=webPlaylandAmusementPark&jobid=4f7758&ibl";

events.title: Access Pass
events.description:
The Annual Access Pass is $58 per year (that's like visiting the Gallery twice!) and gives you unlimited admission to the exhibitions all year long! Get your Annual Access Pass today.

The Monthly Access Pass is a monthly subscription admission pass. For only $5 a month (with a *one-time activation fee of $29) + GST, this option gives you the flexibility to enjoy the Gallery for unlimited individual admission each month you decide to renew.

For the Monthly Access Pass only: Please click YES, RENEW below to have your Monthly Access Pass auto-renew monthly.

*The activation fee will be charged again if the monthly auto-renewal is stopped and restarted.

events.title: Membership
events.description:
At the Vancouver Art Gallery, you’ll find a refuge—a place to pause, reflect and reconnect with yourself through art, creativity and beauty.

Become a member to discover how art opens access to a full year at the Gallery, ideas to share with others, and experiences like no other.

Choose the level that best suits you. Start your experience now!

Is this a gift? Please click here to open the Recipient Contact section. For the Member Name section, please enter the gift recipient's name.

If you are a current or previous Gallery Member, please log in by clicking the MEMBER LOGIN button in this page's top left corner.
For further assistance, please don't hesitate to contact us by email at membership@vanartgallery.bc.ca or by phone at 604.662.4711.

Please note that auto-renewal is NOT for annual memberships. Please leave the default as NO.

events.title: The Centre for Global Asias Fund
events.description:
The Vancouver Art Gallery has a long history of showing works by Asian artists, going all the way back to the Gallery’s founding in 1931. In 2014, the Gallery created a dedicated forum called the Institute of Asian Art (IAA): a platform for research, art education and public engagement. In 2024—the 10th anniversary of the Institute of Asian Art—the IAA was renamed the Centre for Global Asias (CGA) to reflect an expanded scope. 

CGA is a platform dedicated to catalyzing, amplifying and sharing new understandings of modern and contemporary Asian art and thought. The CGA recognizes Vancouver’s unique location on the Pacific Rim and the cultural and geopolitical connections that radiate from here thanks to the diverse people who call this region home. The CGA recognizes the many Asias that exist within the geography of Asia itself and in the global diaspora, as well as within Asias yet to be imagined and yet to come.  

Acting as a vital bridge, the CGA aspires to be Canada’s cultural gateway to the world. The CGA amplifies the work of artists through exhibitions and performances, fosters research within our institution and with other cultural partners, and engages the public through educational tours, dialogue and art experiences. An important part of the CGA’s work is to expand the Gallery’s collections and exhibitions, and to be a gathering place for thought leaders.

Join us in building Canada’s cultural gateway to the world!

events.title: The Art of Wellbeing
events.description: Human beings have long turned to nature and to art for solace and comfort. A walk in a quiet forest, the embrace of a well-loved song, the presence of a powerful painting—we know these to be things that heal us, that connect us to something larger than ourselves. Yet, while these healing powers are widely recognized, formal programs connecting art to those who need it most remain limited. The Vancouver Art Gallery is leading innovative programs that expand access to the healing potential of art. Through the Art of Wellbeing lab, we are making art experiences accessible to you and those who need them most. Our newest initiative, a collaboration with BC Parks Foundation’s PaRx—Canada’s national nature prescription program, allows doctors to prescribe visits to the exhibition Emily Carr: Navigating an Impenetrable Landscape at the Gallery, recognizing the proven benefits of art and nature for mental and physical health. Art Improves Wellbeing. Your Support Makes It Possible. With your help, we can sustain and grow these vital initiatives, ensuring more people experience the transformative power of art.

events.title: Artist Circle
events.description:
Deepen your commitment to the Gallery today and enjoy new levels of access! Supporters who give an annual membership gift from $125/month or $1,500 or above are members of our Artist Circle Membership Patron Program. In recognition of this generous philanthropic commitment, we offer intimate behind-the-scenes benefits and personalized service. Your membership provides vital support to the Gallery and its long-standing commitment to artistic and educational excellence. PERKS
Artist Circle Members unlock exceptional access and enjoy benefits including individual membership benefits and so much more…

CORE BENEFITS
  • Partial charitable tax receipt commensurate to the level of gift
  • Two invitations to three annual Sneak Peek Receptions on Art Opens Celebration Exhibition Openings
  • Two invitations to three annual bespoke Behind the Scenes Artist Circle Events
  • One exhibition catalogue annually
  • Unlimited admission for one full year with express entry privileges and admission for two guests to accompany you on each visit
  • Recognition in the Gallery’s Annual Report and on the Donor Recognition Wall
  • Complimentary one-time-use guest passes
  • Free admission to:
    • Various Public Programs and Events
  • Subscription to our print newsletter and monthly e-newsletter
  • 10% discount online and in-store at the Gallery Store (20% discount during our annual Members' Shopping Week)
  • 10% discount at 1931 Gallery Bistro (excluding alcohol)
  • Discounts on ticketed public programs
  • Museum Alliance Reciprocal Membership with leading art museums and galleries across North America.
  • Free admission to our reciprocal partners:
    • Art Gallery of Alberta, Edmonton
    • Glenbow Museum, Calgary
    • Montreal Museum of Fine Arts
    • Royal Ontario Museum, Toronto
  • Enjoy 20% off admission at Science World, Royal BC Museum and Art Gallery of Greater Victoria
  • Caregiver card for members with special needs
  • Voting privileges at the Annual General Meeting
  • And so much more!
Suggested levels of giving for the Artist Circle Membership include a monthly subscription of $125/month or an annual gift of $1,500, $3,000, $5,000 and $10,000 (for an individual or couple). This donation can be made at once or as a monthly subscription. Gifts of securities are also always welcome and appreciated. Tax receipts are commensurate with the levels of giving.

events.title: The New Vancouver Art Gallery
events.description: Let’s build it together. The Build Up to the new Vancouver Art Gallery at the Chan Centre for the Visual Arts has begun. After celebrating 90 years of operation, the Gallery is embarking on one of the most significant cultural projects undertaken in Canada to date. Together, let's build a future home for the Gallery that defines what a 21st-century museum can be. Construction on the new building has begun with an estimated completion in 2028. Learn more about the new Gallery and how your donation will support every part of our programmatic mission: newvanartgallery.ca

events.title: Member After Hours
events.description:
Join us for two upcoming after-hours tours: July 10 at 5 PM | Otani Workshop: Monsters in My Head, led by Yvette Salazar, Membership Program Assistant and Gallery Art Educator
The tour will bring you into a multisensory landscape shaped by the forests of the Pacific Northwest and Otani Workshop's studio on Awaji Island, situated on the Seto Inland Sea of Japan. August 7 at 5 PM | Lucy Raven: Murderers Bar, led by Siobhan McCracken Nixon, Associate Curator
Dive into the works of multidisciplinary artist Lucy Raven including her newest work, Murderers Bar which centres around the recent removal of a century-old, concrete dam along the Klamath River in Northern California. This special event is offered exclusively to Experiences Members and above, plus one guest. Join or upgrade your Membership today to attend! Find out more » The tour will run for approximately 45 minutes. Please check in at the Membership Desk when you arrive, and Gallery staff will then lead you to the start of the tour on the 2nd Floor. Please log in as a Member to reserve your tickets and to receive complimentary admission for you and one guest. Once reserved, an event ticket will be emailed to you. Please have this digital ticket (or a printout) with you when you arrive at the Gallery.

events.title: Summer Camp at the Gallery
events.description:
This summer, young artists will discover the Gallery as they look at, think about, discuss and create art in new, creative and thoughtful ways!
Summer Camp Session:
July 7 to 11, 2025
9 AM to 1 PM | Ages 7–10
At Summer Camp at the Gallery, participants will have the opportunity to explore four exhibitions through activities and tours. Taking inspiration from the works and ideas on display, campers will then experiment in-studio with a variety of mediums and processes to create their own works of art. Capacity is limited to 20 participants per session. Registration Fee: $220 for Gallery Members | $240 for General Public

events.title: Member Morning
events.description: We've reserved the Gallery especially for you! During a Member Morning, you and one guest will have exclusive access to the Gallery to see the exhibitions on view. Please log in as a Member to reserve your complimentary tickets.

events.title: The Jean Cooperberg Education Fund
events.description: Jean Cooperberg (1942–2022) was a great friend and long-time supporter of the Vancouver Art Gallery. She spent her life involved with many charities, but she was most dedicated to the Gallery’s education program as a docent for 32 years. She was smart and funny and unflappable, capable of creating meaningful conversations about art with even the most challenging of tour groups. In tribute to Jean, donations can be made to the Vancouver Art Gallery in her honour. The funds will be used for a special education project. If you prefer to pay by cheque, please pay to the order of the Vancouver Art Gallery. Cheques can be sent by mail to: Vancouver Art Gallery, 750 Hornby Street, Vancouver, BC V6Z 2H7.

events.title: The Gordon Smith Memorial Fund
events.description: Gordon Smith (1919-2020), beloved artist, educator and philanthropist, was a figure who left an indelible mark on this world. His passing in January 2020 was a tremendous loss, and in celebration of his life and many achievements, the Vancouver Art Gallery is honouring Gordon’s legacy by establishing a memorial fund in his name. Your gift will support exhibitions and publications, educational programming, art conservation and much more. If you prefer to pay by cheque, please pay to the order of the Vancouver Art Gallery. Cheques can be sent by mail to: Vancouver Art Gallery, 750 Hornby Street, Vancouver, BC V6Z 2H7.

events.title: Annual General Meeting
events.description:
The 92nd Annual General Meeting of the Vancouver Art Gallery Association will be held on Wednesday, February 28, 2024 at 5:30PM. The AGM will be held at the Vancouver Art Gallery located at 750 Hornby Street. Please send any questions to Lindsay Sherman, Manager of Strategic Projects & Office of the CEO, lsherman@vanartgallery.bc.ca A copy of the Bylaws, including details regarding the nominations process, is available upon request. WHEN: Wednesday, February 28, 2024 at 5:30 PM
WHERE: Vancouver Art Gallery, 4East Please note that the benefits for Access Pass Holders do not include voting rights at the Annual General Meeting. Access Pass Holders are welcome to attend the AGM; however they will receive a “Non-Voting” slip at the meeting. To obtain voting rights, please upgrade to an Ideas, Experiences or Artist Circle Membership. Please log in if you are an Ideas, Experiences or Artist Circle member to reserve a ticket for the event.

events.title: canada’s first and only vegan night market
events.description: Join us for an unforgettable evening at Canada’s leading plant-based market. Discover delicious food, local drinks, and cruelty-free fashion and beauty - set against a stunning ocean backdrop. Whether you're here to shop, eat, or explore the lifestyle, The Vegan Night Market is your go-to summer hangout. Come hungry.Enjoy complimentary sunset yoga and sound bath from 8 - 9pm - bring your mat and unwind by the sea.upcoming eventsVANCOUVERLocarno Beach 6:00-9:30PMAdmission: Free to publicVancouver’s first and only beach market is back! events.title: Brew at the Zoo
events.location: Greater Vancouver Zoo, 5048 264 St, Aldergrove, BC
events.description:
Get ready for a wildly good time! Our “zoo”nique adults-only event is back on June 21st from 4:00 PM to 9:00 PM, and it’s better than ever. We’re teaming up with some of your favourite local breweries for an evening of craft drinks, live music, and unforgettable animal encounters. General Admission Brew Pass:
Includes access to all alcohol tastings and comes with a keepsake tasting cup and lanyard. Safe Driver Pass:
Includes admission to the event but does not include alcohol tastings or the keepsake items. Join the Greater Vancouver Zoo family and enjoy unlimited year-round access with an Adult Annual Membership. Discover new attractions, learn about our incredible animals, and save money while experiencing the zoo like never before. If you visit the zoo more than once a year, a membership pays for itself in as little as two visits. Plus, members receive an exclusive discount on Brew at the Zoo tickets! Skip the line, buy online. Purchase your e-tickets here. Daily admission, memberships and gift certificates. Whether you’re exploring the Fraser Valley or Vancouver, find the best way to be here. Explore our sprawling acreage! Meet our Animals and Animal Ambassadors, while taking in the beautiful sights and sounds of the Fraser Valley. Phone: 604.856.6825
Email: info@gvzoo.comAddress:5048 - 264th StreetAldergrove, BC V4W 1N7 News
About the Zoo
Support the ZooMembershipGroup RatesJob OpportunitiesVolunteer

An engaging culinary experience driven with purpose; featuring responsibly 
sourced meats, local top chefs, craft beverages and original live music. 
Hosted in Vancouver, Calgary, and Vancouver Island.

Enjoy complimentary sunset yoga and sound bath from 8 - 9pm - bring your mat and unwind by the sea. events.title: BABYMETAL: North America 2025
events.location: Doug Mitchell Thunderbird Sports Centre, 6066 Thunderbird Blvd, Vancouver, BC
events.description:
BABYMETAL
WITH SPECIAL GUESTS JINJER
DOUG MITCHELL THUNDERBIRD SPORTS CENTRE, Vancouver, BC

General tickets go on sale Friday, March 21 at 10AM local!
Venue Presale go on sale Thursday, March 20 at 12PM local (PW: BABY).

Date: Monday, July 14, 2025
Time: Doors – 6:00 PM; Event – 7:00PM
Tickets: Ticketmaster

ABOUT BABYMETAL:
Formed in 2010
SU-METAL(Vocal・Dance)・MOAMETAL(Scream・Dance) ・MOMOMETAL(Scream・Dance)
In April 2016, BABYMETAL became the first Japanese artists to ever headline at the prestigious Wembley Arena in the UK. In June 2019, they performed at one of the world’s largest music festivals, Glastonbury Festival, and their appearance at this festival made headlines around the world. That same year in September, BABYMETAL embarked on their METAL GALAXY
WORLD TOUR. On October 11th, 2019 BABYMETAL had a worldwide release of their 3rd album METAL GALAXY and on that same day, they had their first U.S. headlining arena show at The Forum in Los Angeles, California. METAL GALAXY ranked No. 13 on the US Billboard Top 200 (Albums Chart), largely surpassing their own record of their previous album, and ranked No.1 on the Top Rock Albums Chart for the first time ever as an Asian artist. In the UK Official Charts, the album consecutively ranked in the Official Albums Chart Top 20 from their previous album and ranked No.1 on the Rock & Metal Albums Chart for the first time in history as a Japanese artist.
In 2021, over a four month period from January to April, they accomplished a total of 10 headline performances at the Nippon Budokan called 10 BABYMETAL BUDOKAN. After a 2-year hiatus from live performances, BABYMETAL is scheduled to perform at Makuhari Messe.
In January 2023 they made a comeback at BABYMETAL RETURNS – THE OTHER ONE – where they performed at Makuhari Messe. They released their first concept album called THE OTHER ONE in March 2023. They performed at Pia Arena MM in April at BABYMETAL BEGINS – THE OTHER ONE – and will be supporting Sabaton on their UK & EU Tour in April and May. Following that, BABYMETAL will embark on their world tour starting in Asia and Australia.
Follow BABYMETAL:
Facebook| X | Instagram | YouTube

events.title: Wild Things: The Power of Nature in Our Lives (2018-2020)
events.description: June 28, 2018 - January 12, 2020Recipient of the BCMA Award of Merit: Excellence in Exhibitions 2019!The Museum of Vancouver and Nature Vancouver proudly present the illuminating exhibition, Wild Things: The Power of Nature in Our Lives. This exhibition delves into the life stories of local animals and plants—how they relate to each other and how they connect people to nature in the city. Scenic design, videos, taxidermy, crowdsourcing technologies, and the display of natural specimens breathe life into these tales of co-habitation. The immersive nature of the exhibition, including hands-on activities, encourages visitors to examine their relationship with nature, think about momentarily disconnecting from their devices, and find equilibrium with the natural world around them.  **CONTEST CLOSED** Thank you so much to everyone who submitted their nature photos! The contest winner has been notified.Hancock Wildlife Foundation (HWF) presents a streaming live view of this bald eagle nest located in Delta, British Columbia, Canada.There have been eagles in this territory in Delta, British Columbia, not far from the Tsawwassen Ferry, since at least the late 1990s. They initially took over and rebuilt a red tail hawk nest, then nested on high tension power poles for a few years, then moved back to the nest in 2010 and successfully raised two eaglets.  A camera was installed for 2011, and as of fall 2018, Hancock Wildlife Foundation have watched the pair successfully raise eleven young eagles. Co-CurationLee Beavington, Kwantlen Polytechnic University InstructorViviane Gosselin, MOV Lead CuratorDesign and Co-CurationDaniel Irvine, Principle ArchitectureChad Manley, Chad Manley Practice in Landscape and Building ArtsTerms and Conditions   Privacy Policy   Site Map

events.title: That Which Sustains Us (opened in 2020),
events.description:
That Which Sustains Us is a long-term exhibition that will explore the 
convergence of different knowledge traditions in the Vancouver area through 
an examination of people’s interactions with forests and their natural 
environment.
